sentences: Kuus on igal aastal erineva värvi.
context: The word 'kuus' is the nominative singular form of an Estonian noun meaning 'pine tree'. It refers to the coniferous evergreen tree known as pine in English. In Estonian, it follows normal declension patterns for common nouns and would change form depending on case and number (e.g., plural 'kuused', genitive singular 'kuuse').
